1. Statement of Policy

It is the policy of Gray and Company facility management to implement the requirements of the Risk Management Plan (RMP) by managing and operating the facility in accordance with appropriate regulations and general good operating practices.  The objective is to minimize the risk of a fire or an accidental hazardous material release.  Facility management has developed an Emergency Action Plan to ensure a fast and efficient response in the event of an accidental hazardous material release, fire or other emergency situation.  Gray and Company personnel are expected to cooperate with fellow employees and other support personnel as directed by the emergency action management to assure successful resolution of any emergency. 



2. Source Description and Regulated Substances

The Gray and Company processing facility is located at 3325 W. Polk Road in the county of Oceana.  The facility was brought online May 2020 and the regulated stationary source is sulfur dioxide CAS #7664-09-5 and the maximum intended quantity is approximately 40,000 lbs. 



3. Worst Case and Alternative Case Release Scenarios

Worst case and alternative case release scenarios have been prepared.  Please see onsite personnel for these documents.  



4. Prevention Programs

The Gray and Company facility has in place and is in compliance with the OSHA PSM rule for the sulfur dioxide storage and use.  This prevention program contains all chemical specific prevention steps for our accidental release prevention program. 



5. 5 Year Accident History

This facility has experienced no accidental releases from the covered processes that resulted in deaths, injuries, or significant property damage, or environmental damage. 



6.  Emergency Response Program

This facility has an Emergency Action Plan that has been given to the Oceana County LEPC for use in community emergency coordination planning.  Periodic emergency action plan training will take place with plant personnel. 



7.

Improved Safety 

This facility plans to review all safety programs and procedures to ensure all facility process needs are met.  Facility management personnel will invite the local responding fire department on an annual basis for a facility walk through.  The facility recently had a Process Hazard Analysis completed and will review all of the recommendations made.
